channel.title: Lose/Lose
channel.description:
Hmm, a game that permanently deletes files off your computer the more aliens you kill, but deletes applications when you die. Sounds like a recipe for success!!
[url]https://www.stfj.net/art/2009/loselose/[/url]
Don't worry, the vimeo movie is a movie not the actual game.
The actual game is:
[url]https://www.stfj.net/art/2009/loselose/loselose.zip[/url]
Thoughts?

item.title: Lose/Lose
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
J-Dude:

Mac only? Ha ha ha ha ha…

Well that tickles me, I was going to call this the most evil thing I’d ever seen. I would NEVER try something like this on my computer. My files are irreplaceable. 250 gigabytes of files for seven years of work and development. If my hard drive died, I would probably literally kill myself, I can’t think of anything more evil (computer-wise) than an application that deletes your files.

But for once the high and mighty Macs get to feel the pain?

You have 7 years worth of files and no backup system? Seriously, spend the $150 (at most) and save yourself the tears/hair pulling of a hard drive failing.

Read full topic

item.title: Lose/Lose
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Well, you could technically, but the school finds a way to track you down, as each persons computer is theirs and theirs alone. You could use someone elses, but they would probably find out. But no, he mostly concentrates on getting people who do do something and hoping that that discourages others.

item.title: Lose/Lose

item.description:
If your principal’s really serious about it, does that mean he’s installed a proper security system?

My school’s security sucks, I can log in as admin and fuck with the entire network’s files

item.title: Lose/Lose
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Or a game that fucks with the VRAM, you get weird artifacts the more you play, until your graphics card restarts itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Lose/Lose
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
Kepler:

although i guess people will be playing this game at computer parties. a modified version would be cooler for compo-purpouses though; instead of killing files, you could have every alien represent a segment of your ram: goal of the game, play as long as possible before you BSOD or freeze.

Someone should make this, though with a suggestion that someone else in here made about you protecting it. You have to survive as long as you can protecting your RAM. I’d play it :freeman: .

Read full topic
